metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17189 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Apache HTTP server versions 2.4.37 and prior, by sending request bodies in a slow loris way to plain resources, the h2 stream for that request unnecessarily occupied a server thread cleaning up that incoming data. This affects only HTTP/2 (mod_http2) connections.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17189` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> issue was introduced in 2.4.17 mdeslaur> http2 is disabled in xenial

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6').
